content: Yes, I believe so. As Chinese consumers are increasingly concerned about food safety and health, and demand for locally-produced food products and ingredients continue to grow, there may be a decrease in imported food products in China. The Chinese government has also been promoting the development of domestic food brands and supporting local food production to reduce reliance on imports. Additionally, the recent trade tensions between China and other countries have also led to restrictions and tariffs on imported products, further encouraging the growth of the domestic food industry. However, some imported food products, especially those that are considered high-quality or unique, may still remain popular among Chinese consumers.
